storyInfo: Loken is released from prison, Ferdinand returns, Ho'olheyak and Muelsyse battle each other, Kal'tsit joins the fray, and a shooting star falls to the ground. It's about to rain in Trimounts.

attributes.text: If, in a century or a millennium, our descendants walk among the stars, the masses will sing her praises.'

attributes.content: She sat on a tree stump, humming as she observed the shapes of the clouds above. It was not until her mother called for her that she hopped off and ran toward the voice.
The low flight that they were about to take was all too familiar to her parents. Otherwise, they would not have taken her along.
Her goggles were strapped on, and her seatbelt fastened. As the engines roared, the aircraft began to slide down the runway.
The wind brushing her cheeks grew stronger and stronger. Scared, she closed her eyes.
Then, her body felt very light. A nauseous feeling gushed through her larynx, and her heart raced to the tip of her throat. She squeezed tightly into her mother's embrace.
Fortunately, the feeling didn't last very long. When the aircraft stopped jolting, she slowly relaxed.
But she was still afraid to open her eyes...
Until her mother lightly tapped her shoulder.
She finally found the courage to open her eyes and look around.
From this angle, the city where she had lived her whole life felt so foreign and strange. The crowds that she was struggled to squeeze through now looked like tiny, insignificant insects.
Her mother pointed up, prompting her to look.
The sky was so clear and bright.

attributes.text: Outskirts of Max, District of Columbia, Columbia, 1099
\nFederal Nomadic Prison

attributes.content: Sir, you're sick.
attributes.name: Finely Dressed Man

attributes.content: What? I'm as healthy as can be.
attributes.name: Prison Supervisor

attributes.content: No, I can tell. Alcoholic, crapulent, and insomniac. In this oppressive nomadic prison, surely you haven't had the chance to enjoy much of the finer things in life?
attributes.name: Finely Dressed Man

attributes.content: Heh, you're right about that.
attributes.name: Prison Supervisor

attributes.content: Haha, I mean no offense.
attributes.name: Finely Dressed Man

attributes.content: I get the sense that you might need some rest and recreation. Have you been to Siesta? Minos?
attributes.name: Finely Dressed Man

attributes.content: Please stop making fun of me.
attributes.name: Prison Supervisor

attributes.content: No, no. This is an invitation. Please, choose one. Think of it as a way to kill time as this boring wait drags on.
attributes.name: Finely Dressed Man

attributes.content: ...Minos.
attributes.name: Prison Supervisor

attributes.content: Ah, Minos... The fruity aroma of its streets rides the wind past its pristine white walls. More importantly, the innate elegance of its beauties will have you reluctant to leave...
attributes.name: Finely Dressed Man

attributes.content: Alright, alright. I can already imagine the extravagant life you live. I'm green with envy—
attributes.name: Prison Supervisor

attributes.content: No, what I'm saying is that it's all prepared for you. 'All prepared for you.'
attributes.name: Finely Dressed Man

attributes.content: What do you mean?
attributes.name: Prison Supervisor

attributes.content: I believe an illness like yours can only be cured in such an environment. And you've been a great help for me across a variety of matters. Men like you deserve the finest of treatments.
attributes.name: Finely Dressed Man

attributes.content: After a few months, any gloominess clouding your mind will have completely dissipated. You'll be as strong and sturdy as the Minoan craftsmen. You may even enjoy a stimulating romantic encounter.
attributes.name: Finely Dressed Man

attributes.content: —Mr. Justin Fitzroy Jr. Let me say this again. I'm fine. Please stop toying with me.
attributes.name: Prison Supervisor

attributes.content: Please, Mr. Justin was my father, call me Justin Jr.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: *sigh*... Alright, Justin Jr... So even Business Section people at Rhine Lab know their medicine?
attributes.name: Prison Supervisor

attributes.content: No, no, no. I don't know the first thing about medicine. Who would be interested in something so complicated that can affect no visible, immediate change?
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Then what in the world are you talking—
attributes.name: Prison Supervisor

attributes.content: I'm sure you're dying to know what kind of illness you have and who spread it to you.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Take a look around you and remember—
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Your superior, that unsympathetic, good-for-nothing judge, and even the old warden, so unpleasant even after he retired...
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: You should've been hailed as a hero after you retired from pioneering, or at the very least enjoyed a comfortable life with a fancy house in a nomadic city on a government stipend.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: But now?
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Y-You looked into my background?
attributes.name: Prison Supervisor

attributes.content: That's suiting medicine to the illness, sir. And the way I see it—
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: —your situation is hopeless.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: The remedy I prescribe is a vacation, a luxurious home, bottles of fine wines, beautiful specimens of your preferred gender, and top-notch security service.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: I... I don't understand. I know what you came here for. You're gonna take that one back with you.
attributes.name: Prison Supervisor

attributes.content: If you made it all the way here without trouble, then Rhine Lab and the brass must already have an agreement?
attributes.name: Prison Supervisor

attributes.content: What's the point of bribing me now?
attributes.name: Prison Supervisor

attributes.content: I need an answer first. Are you willing to take fate into your own hands?
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Heh. Who isn't?
attributes.name: Prison Supervisor

attributes.content: Right, which is why you're very unlucky, and also lucky in a way. At the very least, you know the obstacle in front of you and your predicament. For instance, you've always played lackey to someone else. You were deliberately ignored, and cast here.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: You also know what you want. For instance, you've been planning to propose to a certain someone, which got delayed by this trip, right? Oh~ I wonder how that proposal would go on the Minoan plains?
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Ah... Yes... I... haha.
attributes.name: Prison Supervisor

attributes.content: What do you need me to do, Justin Jr.?
attributes.name: Prison Supervisor

attributes.content: It's simple. Sell the information on all of the prison's 'special procedures' to Rhine Lab. I guarantee you'll find the price I'm willing to pay more than attractive.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Th-That certainly wouldn't be hard, but...
attributes.name: Prison Supervisor

attributes.content: But you'll be held accountable? Haha, we came prepared.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: I mean it. The old men behind you have a serious appetite. I spent twice my budget to get all this in order... They've been plenty arrogant the last couple years, and that won't do.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Those greedy, selfish idiots haven't been willing to face facts. What, do they think they're some kind of Ursus or Leithanian nobles? Haha.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: I prefer practical men like you, and so does Rhine Lab.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: So, you could make a considerable fortune out of all this. Then, you and I can send those stubborn old men to prison. They won't get a chance to turn things around for the rest of their miserable lives.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Doesn't that sound nice?
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: You want me to defect—?!
attributes.name: Prison Supervisor

attributes.content: I... Uh. Hold on.
attributes.name: Prison Supervisor
Prison Supervisor
attributes.content: Who the heck...? Couldn't have picked a worse time. Hm, a letter from the bank? I thought I paid it all off...

attributes.name: Prison Supervisor
attributes.content: ...Ugh!
attributes.joined: Who the heck...? Couldn't have picked a worse time. Hm, a letter from the bank? I thought I paid it all off......Ugh!

attributes.content: Justin Jr... This money?
attributes.name: Prison Supervisor

attributes.content: Did I forget to mention? Haha, my bad. Seems I'm not fit to be a doctor. This is your first course of treatment.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: So much...
attributes.name: Prison Supervisor

attributes.content: And the most effective cure for your disease is—'power and wealth.'
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: I guarantee it will get to the root of the problem... on behalf of Rhine Lab.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: I understand.
attributes.name: Prison Supervisor

attributes.content: Pleasure to work with you, Justin Jr.
attributes.name: Prison Supervisor

attributes.content: The pleasure is mine.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Let me ask one more thing. Is Rhine Lab full of men like you?
attributes.name: Prison Supervisor

attributes.content: Hm? No, no, no, no... They're all freaks. The freakiest you've ever seen. But I'm cool with freaks.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Like the one we're looking for today.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: It's all ready, sir.
attributes.name: Jailer

attributes.content: Good, good. After all that effort, I finally get to meet our famous freak.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Please don't forget what we talked about. I hope you'll be at my cocktail party in Trimounts next month... As my personal guest. No invitation necessary.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.text: She stood in the center on the day of her parents' funeral. People came and went around her.

One after another, men she didn't know offered their condolences in front of her parents' portraits.\nA science journal's editor-in-chief, a high-level government official, a legendary investor in the finance world, the representative of a technology conglomerate...
All of them looked so, so saddened. Saddened that the genius inventor husband and wife brought the world of science to new heights, only to both die young.

None of them could understand. They couldn't understand why, when this era-defining technology—flight—had just taken off, why would they waste their energy and effort on something as meaningless as reaching the highest altitude possible.
All of them were furious. Furious that, with the death of the Wrights, the government-sponsored plans became a laughing stock, and their enormous investments had all gone down the drain.
One by one, the guests all left. She alone stood in front of her parents' grave and lifted her head up to look at the clear sky.
Yet it was so, so dark and gloomy.

attributes.content: The light is blindingly bright.
Past the passageway's dark shadows, the uncharacteristically bright lights keep Justin Fitzroy Jr from opening his eyes.
The brightly glowing laboratory is, right, exactly the same as the ones in Trimounts.
Justin Jr. takes two steps to feel things out and finds his attention instinctively drawn to the equipment so clean and shiny that there is light reflecting off of it.
'How much did this cost to build? They built all this for this one man's sake?'
Deep in an area of the laboratory untouched by light, an old man whose face is hidden guards a radio as ancient as himself.
...Haha. This is a prison? You call this a prison?
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Goddamn. Kristen built a whole replica lab here just for you?
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: She thinks really highly of you, doesn't she, Convict No. 30?
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: You aren't the regular liaison, but I've seen your face.
attributes.name: No. 30

attributes.content: You're a Rhine Lab director?
attributes.name: No. 30

attributes.content: Well, that's just hurtful. I played no small part in expanding the company to its current size in such a short period of time. How could Kristen not have told you about me?
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: I have no interest in people like you. I'm a sick, crippled man. What do you want from me?
attributes.name: No. 30

attributes.content: ...Don't talk like that.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: I've read your file. You were extraordinary. If it wasn't for—
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: *cough*—*cough* *cough*—
attributes.name: No. 30

attributes.content: Sorry, I'm pretty sensitive about the past.
attributes.name: No. 30

attributes.content: Oh. Alright.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: But I'm really curious. What is it that Kristen wants you to accomplish so badly she went to all this trouble?
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: She didn't tell you... *cough*... which means you have no need to know, boy.
attributes.name: No. 30

attributes.content: This isn't the first time a science freak has mocked me.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Well, no biggie. My job here is to take you away. Looks like your little project has moved on to its next stage. She needs you there in person.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: It's about her 'survival plan.'
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: ...So you do know, you sly little punk.
attributes.name: No. 30

attributes.content: All I know is Kristen has had you working on something to do with Originium and the human body.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: It's not my area of expertise, but at the very least, I know one thing. Rhine Lab's Control is not a coward who fears death, and she definitely has no illnesses that need healing—
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Which means there's something else going on that's making her desperate for a way to extend her life... some kind of extreme circumstances.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: You're a smart one... No wonder she chose you to bring me out of this place.
attributes.name: No. 30

attributes.content: But you'll have to wait a little longer. It's almost time for the Vice President's speech.
attributes.name: No. 30

attributes.content: A speech? You're into politics now?
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: No, today is going to be an interesting day. Patience is a virtue, kid.
attributes.name: No. 30

attributes.content: Now, we still have to introduce ourselves. I'm...
attributes.name: No. 30

attributes.content: Loken Williams.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: It's a pleasure. I'm Justin Fitzroy Jr., Business Section Director at Rhine Lab, an outsider to the world of science and technology.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: I'm only here to bear witness to history, sir.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Dear Columbians of Trimounts. This is your Vice President, Conrad Jackson.
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: I'm sure many of us are confused by today's press conference. Before I explain anything, I'd like to have a chat with you all.
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: Do any of you feel that, on our Terra today, it's gotten hard to focus just on the cities or even the country in which we reside...?
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: There is more and more to be proven, exchanges between nations have become more frequent, and likewise conflicts and confrontations have become more intense and unavoidable.
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: So I want to ask all of you. Columbia has only be around for a handful of decades, but our history is already as rich as any other nation's. What is it that we have used to achieve this?
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: It's our thirst for knowledge that drives us to explore the boundaries and depths of science. It's the pioneering spirit that flows in the veins of every single Columbian. That's my answer. That's our answer.
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: And to 'maintain' these two things, we are always willing to pay the price, no matter how high it may be.
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: What is Jackson talking about?
attributes.name: Solemn Trimounts Resident

attributes.content: The next election is right around the corner. He hasn't really done anything the last couple years, so he's probably anxious.
attributes.name: Lively Trimounts Resident

attributes.content: Paying a high price...?
attributes.name: Solemn Trimounts Resident

attributes.content: He's not exactly off to a great start.
attributes.name: Solemn Trimounts Resident

attributes.content: In this city of technology, Trimounts, there are over a dozen special plates—
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: On those plates, we're working tirelessly on countless research projects. We're developing, discovering, and guaranteeing our future ways of life...
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: Many of you here are participating in those projects, and I am very proud of you.
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: In just two weeks, we will announce an achievement that is truly the greatest among them.
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: It will change the landscape of international relations. It will allow us to seize the initiative, to never again to fear any storm across any lands.
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.text: It will be Columbia's first step into a new era.

attributes.content: First step into a new era...?
attributes.name: Man in Military Uniform

attributes.content: I heard Jackson was already a famous orator and activist back in college... Heh.
attributes.name: Man in Military Uniform

attributes.content: And now he's holding a press conference in Trimounts. You know what that means, right?
attributes.name: Man in Military Uniform

attributes.content: Let's cut to the chase, Colonel Blake.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: You need my help, and I need yours. This is easy.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Help... yeah... sure.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: A super weapon crafted specifically to keep that damned Shard of Londinium in check... Who knows how much money the military poured into that thing?
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: But now, Kristen and all the techs on the project have disappeared without a trace, overnight.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: And that—What does the handbook call that big ring again? 'H.A.M.H.R.R.?' Dammit... How did she hide such a big thing?
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: The military is being pretty gentle as it is, not surrounding the city with an entire fleet of high-speed battleships.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: And this is what I'm here for.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: I have to admit... Kristen really took me for a ride this time, but what reason do I have to believe that a failure like you can take care of this problem?
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: There are lots of companies in Columbia that can rival Rhine Lab. There's nothing stopping us from taking a military approach and handing everything over to some other place—
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: —You're right, Colonel Blake. I failed, but I'm no fool.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: If the military were really that hardy, you would have done this a long time ago. You army guys were never the meek humanitarians you're trying to play.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: And I, the... former Director of Energy... I know Rhine Lab. With my help, whatever you end up doing will go much smoother.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Especially if you want to take care of this as quickly and as quietly as possible.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Why should I trust you again?
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: Is there anyone easier to keep in check than a failure with nothing to his name?
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: I never thought there would come a day when you called yourself a failure, Ferdinand. Why are you so fixated on this?
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: Always high-and-mighty, never revealing her secrets. She threw everyone's hard work and achievements under the bus, sacrificing the whole of Rhine Lab...
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Kristen doesn't have the right. No one does.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Alright. That's the most convincing thing you've said today.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: Hallway outside Control's office, Rhine Lab, Trimounts
I don't actually like this feeling a whole lot.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Too quiet... The air's so chilly and dry, and the light's awfully cold. No idea what's up ahead, either.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Things weren't so lively back in the day... Most of the time, everyone was just busy with research.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: We rarely ever saw each other, but after meetings, we'd party and get drinks, pad the table legs with the project reports we'd just finished.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: I miss that feeling... The feeling of being accepted, the feeling that we were making a difference, that our work had purpose.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: You have to feel nostalgic for that too, don't you...?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: ...Kristen.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: You can stop dragging your gross tail across the floor? Nobody's coming to clean today...
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Ho'olheyak.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Oh, so you come here to cry your eyes out, huh? Guess I should've stayed hidden a little longer.
attributes.name: Ho'olheyak

attributes.content: Were you waiting for me?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Mm-hm.
attributes.name: Ho'olheyak

attributes.content: Then why are you standing all the way over there?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: I've got to be careful. A kid who just lost her parents might have a pretty bad temper.
attributes.name: Ho'olheyak

attributes.content: Besides, I thought you already had a water clone ready the moment I stepped into the room?
attributes.name: Ho'olheyak

attributes.content: Since I'm found out, I might as well drown you right away and stuff you into a dead power armor.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Oh, I didn't know you were such a vengeful elf.
attributes.name: Ho'olheyak

attributes.content: A Maylander agent infiltrating this place, huh? What are you up to?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Infiltrating? Think again. Would Control's office be that easy to infiltrate?
attributes.name: Ho'olheyak

attributes.content: Are you working for Control? What kind of deal do you two have, and what's she got you doing for her?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Are you betraying the Maylander Foundation for this, K'uk'ulkan?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: So many questions. Why don't you ask Kristen yourself? You're so close to her, I'm sure she'd tell you.
attributes.name: Ho'olheyak

attributes.content: Right... You're at the end of your rope. Why else would you expect to find Control in her office? *sigh*.
attributes.name: Ho'olheyak

attributes.content: Kristen really asked you to come?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: If I told you I invited myself here, would that make your heart ache more?
attributes.name: Ho'olheyak

attributes.content: She doesn't have the time to deal with you right now.
attributes.name: Ho'olheyak

attributes.content: Perhaps she's already sick of all your backstabbing and all your distractions. Maybe she never had a place for you in her plans. Whatever you want to think...
attributes.name: Ho'olheyak

attributes.content: That's not your place to say.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: I'm just trying to remind you out of the kindness of my heart—or pity, if that's how you want to see it—that you should try to not be so tense.
attributes.name: Ho'olheyak

attributes.content: Don't you think you know her better than I do, K'uk'ulkan. I've known her a lot longer than you have.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Maybe I don't understand her, but I know what it is she's trying to do.
attributes.name: Ho'olheyak
Ho'olheyak
attributes.content: It's hard to blame someone for grasping at straws when they're desperate, but if you get in the way...

attributes.name: Ho'olheyak
attributes.content: ...Next time, I'll really kill you.
The dreadful Liberi has vanished. Aside from the droplets of water on the sofa, the fight earlier might as well have never happened.
The door closes; Muelsyse doesn't try to give chase.
There's no telling how much truth there was to Ho'olheyak's words, but her presence alone already explains a lot.
She should ask Kristen directly. This is why she came here today, and she still has many other questions.
...Kristen.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: There is no one here to answer her. Muelsyse's voice echoes throughout the empty office. Her shadow is split into two halves by the wall, like two people standing at a branching path.
When and where did this all begin? Everything that once was has changed, yet she knew nothing about it.
This familiar room... this familiar hallway both seem so foreign to her now.
She hates this feeling.
It's just like the time after she was born, when she realized for the first time that she was all alone in the world.

attributes.text: On the day of Rhine Lab's foundation, everyone had faith that this was the starting point of a company destined for greatness.
The idea made everyone nervous. It cheered them all up. It put smiles on their faces. It kept them up at night.
She and Saria chatted about the future on the balcony until the next day's beaming sunrise shone directly into their eyes.
At that moment, she thought that she, Saria, and all these people would walk with Rhine Lab forever.
It was an unrealistic notion.
When topics like profit, conflict, and misunderstanding piled onto her desk one after another, she couldn't help but laugh... What exactly is confining mankind?
She lifted her head to look at the sky...
It was so, so ugly.

attributes.content: Rest stop, Trimounts Outskirts, roughly eighteen miles from the city center
Hi there. Four large cheese dogs, extra cheese.
[(name="Street Hawker")]You got it. Coming right—
attributes.name: Street Hawker

attributes.content: Holy shit, bro, what the heck is this?
attributes.name: Street Hawker

attributes.content: I caught some kind of disease when I was a kid. It's only because of the exoskeleton that I'm still alive. Sorry for spooking you.
Spooking me? Hell no, that looks so cool.
attributes.name: Street Hawker

attributes.content: Oh... so it's got to do with the Trimounts tech companies? No wonder. The gizmos they pump out are evolving so fast!
attributes.name: Street Hawker

attributes.content: ...Something like that.
Uh, my bad. That was probably rude of me, acting so surprised.
attributes.name: Street Hawker

attributes.content: I'm used to it. Mind if I smoke here?
You can still smoke? That's amazing.
attributes.name: Street Hawker

attributes.content: —Phew, so empty here. This road doesn't get much traffic, does it?
Just today. When the Vice President came through not long ago, the traffic jam was miles long.
attributes.name: Street Hawker

attributes.content: Maybe it's the weather—Here, your hot dog. That's some appetite you've got, bro. Take a seat wherever you want. Not like there's anyone else today.
attributes.name: Street Hawker

attributes.content: Thanks.
'Hot dog,' huh... Columbian fast food really is really making strides.
Well, it's all the same to me.
So why are they called 'hot dogs' again? Anything to do with the Perros?

It was the first wave of Bolívarian settlers who introduced this particular food item to the Columbian masses. This type of sausage sandwich was frequently sold in knight competition arenas at food carts attended by scantily clad Perro females or well-built Perro males.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: And with the passage of time, this food item came to be known as the 'hot dog' in Columbian parlance.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Passage of time, huh? Funny how things can turn out just because of time.
Want one, miss? My treat.
No, thank you.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: *sigh*, the years really haven't been kind. When I still had a sense of taste, my appetite was probably a dozen times what it is now. I guess that's how things turn out with the passage of time.
I envy a young lady like you.
I wonder how many things on Terra are built atop of this passage of time.
Everything is.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I guess you are right about that.
It's been a while, Dame Kal'tsit. When was the last time we met?
The day of Theresa's ascension ceremony after the war was over. Most Sarkaz who still had a lingering nostalgia for Kazdel were there. You were no exception.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: What should I call you now?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Tin Man. That's what my coworkers call me. It's an apt descriptor, and not like names have much meaning to me anymore.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: You represent the Maylander Foundation.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I do.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: A powerful revenant.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: An once-powerful revenant. And besides, you know that the Teekaz are closely connected to every corner of the world, and the Columbian plains are no exception.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: Or would it make you feel better if I told you the whispers of hatred still keep me up at night, and that I can't wait to turn into a flying fortress and fly straight back to Kazdel?
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: No. So the Maylander Foundation noticed Rhodes Island long ago.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: This isn't the first time you've showed up on Columbia's radar, even if the last time was just a minor legal dispute... Was that in Tkaronto or someplace else?
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: Rhodes Island is still a young organization.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: You know who it belonged to and what course it is taking.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: *sigh*, I'm not trying to talk you into giving up, but based on our agents' intel, too many old friends are mixed up in this mess. A fair amount of them are your old friends, too.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: I have no issues with Rhodes Island getting involved in this, so long as you hear Maylander's thoughts first.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: Is it thoughts you want Rhodes Island to hear or demands?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Regardless, personally speaking... I do hope we're on the same side this time, Dame Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: I understand.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Are those girls yours?
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: The Tin Man lifts his head up to gaze at the bottom of the dark clouds. Not far away, a pure white Feline and a fire-red Savra sit on a bench.
The Savra girl enthusiastically tries to tell something to her buddy, but her buddy simply stares at the sky, seemingly paying no attention whatsoever.
She is thinking about the past.
She seems to know why she received that letter and why she had to come back to this country, but she actually doesn't understand it all that well.
She is simply thinking that there are things you have to face, sooner or later.
Hm. I should remember this place, but... I don't think I wrote it down.
attributes.name: Rosmontis

attributes.content: Why didn't I write it down?
attributes.name: Rosmontis

attributes.content: Do I... need to remember this place?
attributes.name: Rosmontis

attributes.content: Duh. You don't remember anything, no matter what I ask you. This sucks!
attributes.name: Ifrit

attributes.content: Do you remember?
attributes.name: Rosmontis

attributes.content: Me? O-Of course I remember!
attributes.name: Ifrit

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Rosmontis

attributes.content: This is Columbia! I've been here, and I hear you've been, too!
attributes.name: Ifrit

attributes.content: Oh... I remember them... I see now.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: It's a cruel twist of fate, Kal'tsit, but you'll have children so young face their fate head on?
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: This is their decision. I have no right to intervene.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Kal'tsit silently looks at Trimounts shrouded in dark clouds in the distance.
Its tall skyscrapers remain under the thick, dark clouds; its base hidden by the fields around them.
Likewise, the Tin Man lifts his head.
Up in the sky above the city and the entire lands, at an unreachable altitude that mankind has dreamt of reaching for thousands of years—
—A burning fireball is tearing through the skies like a falling star.

attributes.text: Ifrit, do you want to hear a story?
A story... Alright. Today's story takes place in a beautiful city in Sargon...
There was once a well-respected king, loved by his people, but when he finally grew old, he had an anxious look on his face, never calming down for even a second.
He gave it his all to rule his city, but he found that not one thing in the city would bear his mark forever. His statues would crumble, and his legends would fade. People forget too easily.
In the final days of his life, he eagerly hoped for there to be something that could truly symbolize his whole legacy and ensure that it would be told for generations to come.
And so, he asked his wife. He hoped to find this treasure with her together.

They searched all over the lands and found a bottomless pit of gold, clothing that restored youth, a magic mirror that allowed its user change races at will, a sword that could rend mountains, and a treasure map that led to mythical realms.
None of these were what the king wanted. They were all too specific, and the desires they bore were too strong. The old king did not think any of these could represent his legacy.
This left the queen stricken with grief. She prayed to the night skies that her husband would get his wish. Finally, hearing her faithful prayers, a star arrived in the mortal realm—

attributes.content: Ifrit stares blankly at the blazing red tail sweeping through the sky.
She suddenly recalls a story out of the thousands that Silence has told her.

Legend has it, there is always hope wherever a star so happens to land. The differences that divide mankind are mended the moment the star reaches the ground, and everyone's wishes will be fulfilled all at once.
Will a star come falling down? There's no time to think. Time is flying by.

attributes.text: I wish for—
